title: What are some of the best software for creating lyric videos? - Quora

response.answer_text: In short answer: Adobe After Effect and Premiere on Windows , Final Cut Pro on Mac, LyricVideoCreator on Windows and KineMaster on mobile phone. If youare an expert and have the demand to create something truly creative and innovative videos…After Effects on Windows (or Final Cut Pro on mac) is your best bet as it focuses on making motion graphics with eye-catching effects. With it, you can create multiple layers to edit videos, audios, images, and text. As for moving backgrounds, brand logos, motion text, stickers, color suppression, or other things, you can easily make with Adobe Premiere with or without the variety of ready-made plugins or templates. You can make a little research on Google. Some templates are free to use.  Incidentally, though it takes some learning curve to master Adobe After Effects, there are a lot of video tutorials on YouTube that can help you to quickly walk through. Besides, the workflow on editing videos in AE is very similar like Photoshop and Premiere. Therefore, it may safe to say AE is also useful for beginners or anyone who learned one or two programs of Adobe family. If you are looking for some tools to quickly sync all lyrics to music, word by word or line by line…Then you can use LyricVideoCreator and it enable you to tap to match lyrics and songs. I make lyrics video for In Your Eyes (from The Weeknd) in 35minitues with all text synchronize by using LyricVideoCreator. To correctly synchronizing all texts, I just need to listen to the music once and there are few marks that need to be adjusted manually.  Besides, it also allows me to add music, video, image background, and it supports to animate the text, backgrounds, and many objects. I also tried out SuperString after seeing the answers under this query. It is truly powerful. Everything things to be customizable and you can easily make stunning contents with it. Temporarily, it is a perfect product for me. It is reported to be buggy when importing a video background, so be careful when you selecting the background material. If you miss click + Video, all work you made previously may be destructed. You may need to build everything from scratch.  Online lyrics video editors, as like Flexclip, win on copyright free music stock and templates, but they are too basic in functions and are troublesome to sync lyrics which definitely not good to create any creative outcomes (at least the tools I tried thus far aren’t good at editing lyric videos). If you want a good lyric video maker app on mobile phones,then I recommend you to use KineMaster. It supports dozens of music and video layers, and even allows you to keyframe effects. It did take a longer time to mark each line and enter all lyrics to get the finished work, but it is convenient for extracting files from your phone and fast applying your innovations everywhere.

A lyric video is ain’t just about the lyric alone. It’s also about the song, its music, and the emotions it carries along with it.  Many beginners who create lyric videos nowadays are doing injustice to the original cover. They focus more on the right tools but forget the right way. They miserably fail to capture the essence and feel of the song. When you create a lyric video, you should also think about how you could make it visually interesting and transfer the beauty in the original cover into your lyric video. For a good lyric video, you would require the following elements along with the audio track and the lyric. 1.) Images & Videos - Find the right images and videos that can match the lyric in the song. 2.) Text with Animations - Text animations are the heart of the lyric video. 3.) Special animation effects - Animation effects help you bring the right feel to the song. 4.) Camera effects - Camera effects can make your lyric video look more lively. 5.) Creativity - It is the most important and underrated skill that can make your video look as good as the original cover! Now let's talk about the tool that can help you create lyric videos. Any normal video editor can do the job of adding text to a video. But as I said earlier a lyric video is not just about the text alone. In general, for all my video production purposes, I use an online application called animaker.com I use it for both 2D Animation and live video making. It also has stock photos and videos, text animation, camera effects etc. required to create a lyric video. I mainly use it for my youtube videos. I think it can be the right choice for lyric video making also. I hope this answer helps! :)

What are some of the best software for creating lyric videos? Obviously, YouTube Movie Maker is the best one, it built-in a free powerful Lyric Video Maker , with it you can easy to create nice lyric videos, just need few steps. run YouTube Movie Maker, click “Make Videos”click upper left red “LRC” button to open the built-in “Lyric Video Maker”then you can easy to sync the lyrics and music in Lyric Video Maker window, and select types, then save as a lyrics file(*.rzlrc)At last, back to the program main window, add the saved lyrics file(*.rzlrc) to a Text line, add music into Audio Line, then click lower right “RENDER” button to output the nice lyrics video.

This one’s is just for the lyrics part though, not for the video, though equally important. If you ever need to write lyrics for a song, and want some quality starters, go for this one- Song Lyrics Generator Here you will find a bunch of themes, i.e., what you want your song to be like. Example- Freestyle, romantic, rap, etc. Select any one of them, and a form will appear. Fill in the form, it will ask you things like what is the song length, its title, its inspiration and other such details, details about the protagonist of the song (i.e., the main character), what he/she likes, hates, etc. The form also has an auto-fill feature for every option, which will automatically fill out a field for you from a random bunch of choices, in case if you are not getting any ideas. Click the submit button at the end after filling in the form and make the world dance to your tunes!!

Stick with After Effects and use some plugins to take some of the work load of easing and smoothing out camera and letter movement. Use 3D camera moves and animate text layers to pop in or scale in from zero -timed to the lyrics. Add fun and interesting elements of the song into your visuals. Here’s a lyric video I did using After Effects and Cinema 4D for the models.  Most of the camera easing and overshoot work in this video is handled by Andrew Kramer’s free Sure Target 2 plugin. Most of the text scales in from zero with a bounce expression you can find on Dan Ebert’s site. About 90 percent of the animation you see in the video is done by moving the camera.

The best software for making lyric videos is Adobe Premiere Pro.  There are a lot of reasons for it. The first is because Premiere Pro is a professional software with an infinite number of features. Moreover, it even supports VST plugins that may be handy when making music videos as VSTs are used for processing sound. But the best thing about it is that Premiere Pro comes as a part of Creative Cloud pack which includes apps like After Effects for making visual effects and animations, Audition for sound processing, Photoshop for editing photos and many more.
